metadata.Title: CVE-2020-6830 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description: For native-to-JS bridging, the app requires a unique token to be passed that ensures non-app code can't call the bridging functions. That token was being used for JS-to-native also, but it isn't needed in this case, and its usage was also leaking this token. This vulnerability affects Firefox for iOS < 25.

notes.Note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine sbeattie> firefox on iOS only

criterions.comment: firefox: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
thunderbird: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
